intro: Adicea glomerata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly serrated, often growing in opposite pairs along the stem. Adicea glomerata thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
